Pre-Game Insights: West Indies are aiming for redemption after a poor recent World Cup performance.
The match is the first of the Caribbean leg of the 2024 T20 World Cup.
West Indies have a strong batting lineup including Nicholas Pooran, Andre Russell, and Rovman Powell.
Papua New Guinea relies on experienced batters like Assad Vala and Tony Ura, and their spin bowler Charles Amini.
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies won the match by 5 wickets with 6 balls remaining.
The match was played at Providence, and the pitch conditions were discussed, with spinners dominant.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The average first-innings score at Providence is 168, with teams often opting to bat second.
There were chances of weather disruptions during the match.
